classes.name: ClosedEndCredit
classes.label: closed-end credit
classes.definition: credit agreement in which the loan principal cannot be increased after funds are dispersed in full when the loan closes

classes.name: CollateralizedLoan
classes.label: collateralized loan
classes.definition: secured loan that is secured with cash or other acceptable collateral (real property, securities or other assets) provided by the borrower as specified in the collateral agreement

classes.name: Comaker
classes.label: co-maker
classes.definition: party that signs a borrower's promissory note, providing additional security and potentially improving the quality of the debt

classes.name: CombinedLoanToValueRatio
classes.label: combined loan-to-value ratio
classes.definition: ratio of the total amount of debt that is secured by the asset(s) and the appraised value of the asset(s) securing the financing

classes.name: GuaranteedLoan
classes.label: guaranteed loan
classes.definition: loan that is secured with respect to repayment of principal and interest by guaranty

classes.name: IndividualPaymentTransaction
classes.label: individual payment transaction
classes.definition: actual payment of principal, interest, fees, or other related amounts towards fulfillment of a debt obligation

classes.name: LenderLienPosition
classes.label: lender lien position
classes.definition: classifier indicating whether the lender has the primary lien position with respect to an asset used as collateral for the loan

classes.name: Loan
classes.label: loan
classes.definition: debt instrument whereby one party extends money or credit to another party (or parties) with the understanding that the borrowed money will be repaid according to the terms of the contract

classes.name: LoanPaymentSchedule
classes.label: loan payment schedule
classes.definition: regular or explicit (ad hoc) payment schedule associated with a given loan-specific account

classes.name: LoanSpecificCustomerAccount
classes.label: loan-specific customer account
classes.definition: account held by the borrower associated with a specific loan

classes.name: LoanToValueRatio
classes.label: loan-to-value ratio
classes.definition: ratio, expressed as a percentage, between the principal amount of the loan and the appraised value of the asset securing the financing

classes.name: OpenEndCredit
classes.label: open-end credit
classes.definition: credit agreement that may be extended up to an agreed credit limit and paid down at any time within the period of the line, if any, and on which interest is charged only on the outstanding balance

classes.name: OwnershipInterest
classes.label: ownership interest
classes.definition: classifier indicating the nature of the applicant's or borrower's ownership or leasehold interest in an asset used as collateral for the loan

classes.name: PaymentHistory
classes.label: payment history
classes.definition: record of actual payments of principal, interest, and other related amounts made by a borrower to a lender or servicer in order to fulfill their re-payment obligation

classes.name: PrepaymentTerms
classes.label: pre-payment terms
classes.definition: principal repayment terms related to payment of the loan prior to maturity

classes.name: SecuredLoan
classes.label: secured loan
classes.definition: loan in which the borrower pledges some asset via a security agreement as collateral for the loan, or that is secured via third-party guarantee

classes.name: Servicer
classes.label: servicer
classes.definition: party that collects principal and interest payments on behalf of the lender

classes.name: TotalOutstandingPrincipal
classes.label: total outstanding principal
classes.definition: the principal balance of all loans secured by the property

classes.name: UnsecuredLoan
classes.label: unsecured loan
classes.definition: loan granted based on the strength of the borrower's credit history or reputation in the community

classes.name: PrivateStudentLoan
classes.label: private student loan
classes.definition: student loan that is not considered a government-backed / regulated loan

classes.name: RegulatedStudentLoan
classes.label: regulated student loan
classes.definition: student loan (1) whose lender is a government agency or instrumentality, and/or (2) that is treated uniquely due to tax regulations

classes.name: StudentLoan
classes.label: student loan
classes.definition: loan provided for the purposes of education, allowing students and parents/guardians to borrow money for college

classes.name: ConsumerLoan
classes.label: consumer loan
classes.definition: loan to one or more individuals for household, family, or other personal expenditures, excluding mortgages and student loans

classes.name: HomeEquityLineOfCredit
classes.label: home equity line of credit
classes.definition: line of credit granted to a homeowner secured by the equity value in a borrower's home or other property

classes.name: MotorVehicleLoan
classes.label: motor vehicle loan
classes.definition: collateralized, simple-interest loan that is repaid in monthly installments over a period of typically three to five years, for the purpose of purchasing a vehicle

classes.name: SecuredConsumerLoan
classes.label: secured consumer loan
classes.definition: loan to one or more individuals for household, family, or other personal expenditures in which the borrower pledges some asset via a security agreement as collateral for the loan, or that is secured via third-party guarantee

classes.name: UnsecuredConsumerLoan
classes.label: unsecured consumer loan
classes.definition: loan to one or more individuals for household, family, or other personal expenditures granted based on the strength of the borrower's credit history or reputation in the community

classes.name: AssessmentBoundary
classes.label: assessment boundary
classes.definition: defined scope, limits, and criteria used to determine what is included or excluded in an evaluation, analysis, or measurement of environmental impacts, sustainability performance, or related objectives

classes.name: EnvironmentalProgram
classes.label: environmental program
classes.definition: broad scale initiative, activity, or investment aimed at improving environmental sustainability, reducing ecological harm, or addressing environmental challenges

classes.name: EnvironmentalProject
classes.label: environmental project
classes.definition: specific initiative, activity, or investment aimed at improving environmental sustainability, reducing ecological harm, or addressing environmental challenges

classes.name: GreenLoan
classes.label: green loan
classes.definition: credit agreement and/or contingent facility (such as a bonding line, guarantee line or letter of credit) made available exclusively to finance, re-finance or guarantee, in whole or in part, new and/or existing eligible green projects that are aligned to the four core components of the Green Loan Principles (GLP)

classes.name: GreenProject
classes.label: green project
classes.definition: project that contributes to environmental sustainability by addressing climate change, conserving natural resources, reducing pollution, or promoting ecological balance

classes.name: GreenProjectUseOfProceedsProvision
classes.label: green project use of proceeds provision
classes.definition: use of proceeds provision specifying that funds obtained through financing, such as through a credit agreement, offering, warrant, or other instrument are intended to be used for Green Projects (including other related and supporting expenditures, including research and development)

classes.name: ObservedIndicatorValue
classes.label: observed indicator value
classes.definition: observation (measurement) of a key performance indicator measured at specific date and time

classes.name: ObservedIndicatorValueStructure
classes.label: observed indicator value structure
classes.definition: collection of observations for some key performance indicator measured over a specified window of time

classes.name: SustainabilityBusinessObjective
classes.label: sustainability business objective
classes.definition: objective related to improving the sustainability profile of the business

classes.name: SustainabilityBusinessStrategy
classes.label: sustainability business strategy
classes.definition: strategy for achieving specific business objectives related to sustainability (from an environmental and/or social and/or governance (ESG) perspective)

classes.name: SustainabilityKeyPerformanceIndicator
classes.label: sustainability key performance indicator
classes.definition: measurable performance indicator that is sustainability specific

classes.name: SustainabilityKeyPerformanceIndicatorIdentifier
classes.label: sustainability key performance indicator identifier
classes.definition: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific sustainability-related key performance indicator

classes.name: SustainabilityLinkedLoan
classes.label: sustainability-linked loan
classes.definition: credit agreement and/or contingent facility (such as a bonding line, guarantee line or letter of credit) for which the economic characteristics can vary depending on whether the borrower achieves ambitious, material and quantifiable predetermined sustainability performance objectives aligned with Sustainability-Linked Loan Principles (SSLP)

classes.name: SustainabilityPerformanceTarget
classes.label: sustainability performance target
classes.definition: collection of quantitative target values used to calibrate the level of achievement a borrower makes with respect to a key performance indicator, by date, including, but not limited to, the methodology used to calculate its value at any point over the lifetime of a loan

classes.name: SustainabilityPerformanceTargetIdentifier
classes.label: sustainability performance target identifier
classes.definition: sequence of characters uniquely identifying a specific sustainability-related performance target

classes.name: SustainabilityStructuringAgent
classes.label: sustainability structuring agent
classes.definition: financial institution appointed to help design, implement, and monitor the sustainability aspects of a syndicated green loan

classes.name: TargetIndicatorValue
classes.label: target indicator value
classes.definition: target value for a key performance indicator as of a specific date and time

classes.name: TransitionLoan
classes.label: transition loan
classes.definition: credit agreement and/or contingent facility (such as a bonding line, guarantee line or letter of credit) designed to help a business or organization shift from carbon-intensive or environmentally harmful practices to more sustainable and environmentally friendly operations

classes.name: TransitionProject
classes.label: transition project
classes.definition: project that supports broad, sector-specific efforts to reduce environmental impact

classes.name: TransitionStrategy
classes.label: transition strategy
classes.definition: strategy for achieving specific business objectives related to sustainability in the context of long-term decarbonization or sustainability transitions

classes.name: TransitionUseOfProceedsProvision
classes.label: transition use of proceeds provision
classes.definition: use of proceeds provision specifying that funds obtained through financing, such as through a credit agreement, offering, warrant, or other instrument are intended to be used to fund specific projects, investments, or operational changes that support a company's transition toward sustainability

classes.name: CardAccount
classes.label: card account
classes.definition: account whose terms and conditions are defined in a card agreement that is represented by a payment card

classes.name: CardAuthenticationValue
classes.label: card authentication value
classes.definition: card verification value specifically for JCB payment cards

classes.name: CardAuthenticationValue2
classes.label: card authentication value 2
classes.definition: card verification value specifically for JCB payment cards

classes.name: CardExpirationDate
classes.label: card expiration date
classes.definition: date on which a given payment card expires

classes.name: CardIdentificationNumber
classes.label: card identification number
classes.definition: card verification value specifically for American Express and Discover payment cards

classes.name: CardProduct
classes.label: card product
classes.definition: financial product involving the issuance of credit, debit, or other payment cards

classes.name: CardSecurityCode
classes.label: card security code
classes.definition: card verification value specifically for American Express payment cards

classes.name: CardValidationCode
classes.label: card validation code
classes.definition: card verification code specifically for Mastercard payment cards

classes.name: CardValidationCode2
classes.label: card validation code 2
classes.definition: card verification value specifically for Mastercard payment cards

classes.name: CardVerificationCodeValue
classes.label: card verification code or value
classes.definition: code that specifies either (1) magnetic-stripe data, or (2) printed security features that are used to protect data integrity and limit alteration, counterfeiting and fraud generally

classes.name: CardVerificationValue
classes.label: card verification value
classes.definition: card verification value specifically for Visa and Discover payment cards

classes.name: CardVerificationValue2
classes.label: card verification value 2
classes.definition: card verification value specifically for Visa payment cards

classes.name: Cardholder
classes.label: cardholder
classes.definition: account holder to whom a payment card is issued

classes.name: CommercialCreditCardAgreement
classes.label: commercial credit card agreement
classes.definition: credit card agreement for a card issued to, or in conjunction with, a formal organization, such as a small business, middle market business, local, state, or national government, or large corporation

classes.name: ConsumerCreditCardAgreement
classes.label: consumer credit card agreement
classes.definition: credit card agreement for a card issued for household, family, or other personal expenditures that is accessed by a borrower's use of a credit card

classes.name: CreditCard
classes.label: credit card
classes.definition: card issued by a financial service provider that enables the cardholder to borrow funds

classes.name: CreditCardAccount
classes.label: credit card account
classes.definition: card account whose terms and conditions are defined in a credit card agreement that is represented by a credit card

classes.name: CreditCardAgreement
classes.label: credit card agreement
classes.definition: account-specific credit facility that specifies the terms and conditions under which the credit card is offered to the cardholder by the issuer

classes.name: CreditCardNetwork
classes.label: credit card network
classes.definition: classifier for the network that authorizes, processes, and sets the terms of credit card transactions, as well as transfers payments between shoppers, merchants, and their banks

classes.name: CreditCardProduct
classes.label: credit card product
classes.definition: card product allowing the holder to purchase goods or services on credit

classes.name: DebitCard
classes.label: debit card
classes.definition: payment card issued by a financial service provider that enables the cardholder to access funds in a demand deposit account

classes.name: DebitCardAccount
classes.label: debit card account
classes.definition: card account that is represented by a one or more debit cards

classes.name: DebitCardProduct
classes.label: debit card product
classes.definition: card product card typically provided by a depository institution allowing the holder to transfer money electronically to another account when making a purchase

classes.name: IssuingFinancialInstitution
classes.label: issuing financial institution
classes.definition: issuer and financial services provider that issues payment cards or performs, facilitates, or supports issuing services including but not limited to issuing banks and issuing processors

classes.name: MagneticStripeVerificationCodeValue
classes.label: magnetic stripe verification code or value
classes.definition: card verification code on a card's magnetic stripe that uses secure cryptographic processes to protect data integrity on the stripe, and reveals any alteration or counterfeiting

classes.name: PaymentCard
classes.label: payment card
classes.definition: legal document issued by a financial services provider that enables the cardholder to access the funds in the customer's designated bank accounts, or through a credit account and make payments by electronic funds transfer and access automated teller machines (ATMs)

classes.name: PaymentCardAgreement
classes.label: payment card agreement
classes.definition: account-specific credit agreement that specifies the terms and conditions under which the payment card is offered to the cardholder by the issuer

classes.name: PrimaryCardAccountNumber
classes.label: primary card account number
classes.definition: composite identifier of 14 or 16 digits embossed on a bank or payment card and encoded in the card's magnetic strip

classes.name: SmartCard
classes.label: smart card
classes.definition: payment card that has integrated circuits embedded within it

classes.name: ThreeDigitVerificationCodeValue
classes.label: three-digit verification code or value
classes.definition: card verification code that is the rightmost three-digit value printed in the signature panel area on the back of the card

classes.name: CommercialLoan
classes.label: commercial loan
classes.definition: loan extended to a corporation, commercial enterprise, joint venture, or other organization as opposed to a consumer

classes.name: ClosedEndMortgageLoan
classes.label: closed-end mortgage loan
classes.definition: loan secured by real estate with no ability for the borrower to receive additional funds under the loan at a later date

classes.name: ClosedEndReverseMortgage
classes.label: closed-end reverse mortgage
classes.definition: reverse mortgage that provides a lump sum payment to the borrower at closing, with no ability for the borrower to receive additional funds under the mortgage at a later date

classes.name: LoanSecuredByRealEstate
classes.label: loan secured by real estate
classes.definition: loan that, at origination, is secured wholly or substantially by a lien or liens on real property for which the lien or liens are central to the extension of the credit - that is, the borrower would not have been extended credit in the same amount or on terms as favorable without the lien or liens on real property

classes.name: Mortgage
classes.label: mortgage
classes.definition: grant of financial interest in real property to a party that is not an owner of that real property and is recorded by a registration authority

classes.name: OpenEndMortgageLoan
classes.label: open-end mortgage loan
classes.definition: loan secured by real estate with a provision that the outstanding loan amount may be increased upon mutual agreement of the lender and the borrower

classes.name: OpenEndReverseMortgage
classes.label: open-end reverse mortgage
classes.definition: reverse mortgage structured like a home equity line of credit in that it provides the borrower with additional funds after closing (either as fixed monthly payments, under a line of credit, or both)

classes.name: ReverseMortgageLoan
classes.label: reverse mortgage loan
classes.definition: loan secured by real estate that pays money to the borrower against a set principal limit based on the value of existing equity in the underlying collateral

properties.name: hasCost
properties.label: has cost
properties.definition: has amount payable for principal, interest, fees or other expenses

properties.name: hasFirstRateChangeTerm
properties.label: has first rate change term
properties.definition: specifies a period of time in months after origination during which the interest rate cannot change

properties.name: hasIndividualPayment
properties.label: has individual payment
properties.definition: links an actual payment of principal, interest, and other related amounts to the overall payment history for an account

properties.name: hasLoanBalance
properties.label: has loan balance
properties.definition: indicates the balance with respect to the principal on the loan as of some date

properties.name: hasPaymentHistory
properties.label: has payment history
properties.definition: relates a credit agreement, loan, or commitment to any history of payments that have been made by the borrower up to the point that payment history is requested

properties.name: hasPrePaymentPenaltyTerm
properties.label: has pre-payment penalty term
properties.definition: relates a loan to a period of time in months after which there is no prepayment penalty

properties.name: hasPrincipalAmount
properties.label: has principal amount
properties.definition: indicates the nominal amount of the loan that must be paid at or before maturity

properties.name: hasScheduledUnpaidBalance
properties.label: has scheduled unpaid balance
properties.definition: indicates what the balance should be after a scheduled payment is made according to contract terms

properties.name: hasTotalClosingCosts
properties.label: has total closing costs
properties.definition: indicates the total the amount paid at the closing of a real estate transaction, i.e., at the time when the title to the property is conveyed (transferred) to the buyer

properties.name: hasTotalPointsAndFees
properties.label: has total points and fees
properties.definition: indicates a form of pre-paid interest, charged by the lender as an alternative to charging a higher rate of interest on the mortgage loan

properties.name: isServicedBy
properties.label: is performed by
properties.definition: relates a loan to the financial service provider that services it

properties.name: hasBalloonPayment
properties.label: has balloon payment
properties.definition: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included repayment of the outstanding principal sum at the end of a loan period, prior to which only partial or no payments were made on the principal

properties.name: hasNegativeAmortization
properties.label: has negative amortization
properties.definition: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included a feature that allows unpaid interest to be added to the balance of unpaid principal

properties.name: isAssumable
properties.label: is assumable
properties.definition: indicates whether or not another borrower may assume the payments on this loan

properties.name: isInitiallyPayable
properties.label: is initially payable
properties.definition: indicates whether the obligation arising from the covered loan was, or in the case of an application, would have been initially payable to the financial institution

properties.name: isInterestOnly
properties.label: is interest only
properties.definition: indicates whether the contractual terms include or would have included interest only payments

properties.name: hasAssessmentBoundary
properties.label: has assessment boundary
properties.definition: indicates the scope, limits, and context for an environmental or sustainability project

properties.name: hasSpatialBoundary
properties.label: has spatial boundary
properties.definition: specifies a geographic region included in an environmental or sustainability assessment, which may cover a specific site, facility, region, or the global operations of a company or project

properties.name: hasCardVerificationCode
properties.label: has card verification code
properties.definition: links a credit card to either: (1) magnetic-stripe data, or (2) printed security features that are used to protect data integrity and limit alteration, counterfeiting and fraud generally

properties.name: hasCreditCardNetwork
properties.label: has credit card network
properties.definition: indicates the underlying network for credit card product

properties.name: hasPrimaryAccountNumber
properties.label: has primary account number
properties.definition: specifies the account number displayed on the face of the card

properties.name: usesCurrency
properties.label: uses currency
properties.definition: indicates the currency defined for the credit card product

properties.name: hasBusinessPurposeDescription
properties.label: has business purpose description
properties.definition: provides a description of the purpose of the loan from the perspective of the borrower

properties.name: hasInitialFundingDate
properties.label: has initial funding date
properties.definition: relates a mortgage to the date on which the contract is consummated, officially creating the obligations therein

properties.name: isARMConvertible
properties.label: is ARM convertible
properties.definition: indicates whether or not the loan can be converted into an adjustable-rate mortgage contract (ARM)

## Disjointness Axioms (CRITICAL - These cause CLASHES if violated!)
- OpenEndCredit  ClosedEndCredit
- UnsecuredLoan  SecuredLoan

## Extraction Guidelines:
1. Extract factual assertions including TYPE CLASSIFICATIONS (e.g., "X is a StudentLoan")
2. For unnamed entities (like "the loan"), use descriptive subjects like "TheLoan"
3. IMPORTANT: Type assertions should use "rdf:type" as predicate
   Example: {"sub": "TheLoan", "pred": "rdf:type", "obj": "StudentLoan", "sub_type": "Loan", "obj_type": "Class"}
4. Map entities to the MOST SPECIFIC class that applies
5. Include relationships between lenders, borrowers, and loans
6. Include loan characteristics (amount, rate, type) when mentioned
7. Each triple must have: sub, pred, obj, sub_type, obj_type

## Output Format:
Return JSON: {"triples": [{"sub": "...", "pred": "...", "obj": "...", "sub_type": "...", "obj_type": "..."}]}

If no triples can be extracted, return: {"triples": []}
